attributes.additional_details:
We would ask the Government to look closely at helping to save iconic land marks in this country instead of being left for developers and such like to make them into flats.

We ''OFF FLINT'' want to keep Cornist Hall as the land mark it has always been, a place for people from all towns and villages to gather and enjoy the hospitality it always had in the past.

Our aim is to Re-open Cornist Hall as a non profit organised community group and bring it back to its former glory as ONE of the best wedding venues and, restaurant's around, and to maintain it's character for generations to come.

rejection.details:
The matter that you raise with us is devolved to the Welsh Government. The Welsh Government has its own facility to receive petitions which can be found at: http://www.assemblywales.org/gethome/e-petitions.htm.

You might also like to contact directly the Welsh Minister for Housing, Regeneration and Heritage, Huw Lewis AM: Huw.Lewis@Wales.gov.uk
